required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-Term Safety Follow-Up Study of SCM-AGH in Subjects Who Participated and Administered SCM-AGH in to Severe Atopic Dermatitis Clinical Trials
clinical_study.official_title: A Long-Term Safety Follow-Up Study of SCM AGH in Subjects Who Participated in the ADT2002 Study

brief_summary.textblock: This is a long-term safety follow-up study of the Phase I/II multicenter study of SCM-AGH in subjects with moderate to severe atopic dermatitis. subjects will be followed up for a maximum period of 240 weeks after the first dose of investigational product. Only subjects previously enrolled in protocol ADT2002 (ClinicalTrials.gov ID: NCT04179760) will be eligible for this long-term follow-up protocol.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects who meet all eligibility criteria for Long Term Follow Up(LTFU) study participation at the ADT2002 End of Treatment(EOT) visit may continue LTFU for a maximum period of up to 240 weeks post first dose of investigational product. No additional dosing will be administered on this LTFU protocol.

primary_outcome.measure: Long-term safety assessment of SCM-AGH in subjects with moderate to severe Atopic Dermatitis(AD)
primary_outcome.description: Number of occurrence of treatment-related adverse events (â‰¥ Grade 3 in severity (NCI-CTCAE, v5.0))

primary_outcome.measure: Long-term concomitant medication assessment of SCM-AGH in subjects with moderate to severe Atopic Dermatitis(AD)
primary_outcome.description: Number of occurrence of use of medications related to adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Outcome of unresolved Adverse Events(AEs) from ADT2002 study

secondary_outcome.description: Number of abnormality in general appearance, skin, eyes/ears/nose/throat, head and neck, cardiovascular, respiratory, abdomen, extremities, lymph nodes, musculoskeletal and neurologic.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of occurrence of Abnormal, clinically significant in hematology laboratory results
secondary_outcome.description: Hematology panel: alkaline phosphatase [ALP], blood urea nitrogen, creatinine, serum aspartate aminotransferase (AST), serum alanine aminotransferase (ALT), albumin, total protein, total bilirubin, uric acid, glucose, cholesterol, sodium, potassium, chloride, calcium, phosphorus

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of occurrence of Abnormal, clinically significant in chemistry laboratory results
secondary_outcome.description: Chemistry panel: hemoglobin, hematocrit, red blood cells, white blood cells (WBC), WBC differential count, platelets

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of occurrence of Abnormal, clinically significant in urinalysis laboratory results
secondary_outcome.description: Urinalysis panel: specific gravity (SG), color, pH, protein, glucose, bilirubin, blood, WBC

study_pop.textblock: Subjects who have received at least 1 dose of SCM-AGH in the ADT2002 study (ClinicalTrials.gov ID: NCT04179760)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects who provide written informed consent
2. Subjects who have received at least 1 dose of SCM-AGH in the ADT2002 study
3. Subjects who are willing to comply with the visit schedule and study requirements for reporting relevant information to the site.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects who are unable to comply with the visit schedule prior to Week 240 after first dose of SCM AGH
